markdownRemark.html:
He that sinneth, sinneth unto himself. He that is unjust, hurts himself, in that he makes himself worse than he was before. Not he only that committeth, but he also that omitteth something, is oftentimes unjust.

V. If my present apprehension of the object be right, and my present

prev.excerpt:
It were indeed more happy and comfortable, for a man to depart out
of this world, having lived all his life long clear from all falsehood…
